parameters.name: Description
parameters.description:
The description of the flow log.

The description must be 1 to 256 characters long and cannot start with `http://` or `https://`.

parameters.name: FlowLogId
parameters.description: The ID of the flow log.

parameters.name: FlowLogName
parameters.description:
The name of the flow log.

The name must be 1 to 128 characters long and cannot start with `http://` or `https://`.

parameters.name: LogStoreName
parameters.description: The Logstore that stores the captured traffic.

parameters.name: PageNumber
parameters.description: The page number, with a default value of **1**.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: The number of items per page in a paginated query, with a maximum value of **50** and a default value of **20**.

parameters.name: ProjectName
parameters.description: The Project that manages the captured traffic.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description:
The region ID of the flow log.

You can obtain the region ID by calling the [DescribeRegions](~~36063~~) interface.

parameters.name: ResourceGroupId
parameters.description: The resource group ID of the flow log.

parameters.name: ResourceId
parameters.description: The resource ID of the traffic to capture.

parameters.name: ResourceType
parameters.description:
The resource type of the traffic to capture. Values:
- **NetworkInterface**: Elastic Network Interface (ENI).
- **VSwitch**: All ENIs within a VSwitch.
- **VPC**: All ENIs within a VPC.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description:
The status of the flow log. Values:
- **Active**: The flow log is in an active state.
- **Activating**: The flow log is being created.
- **Inactive**: The flow log is in an inactive state.

parameters.name: TrafficType
parameters.description:
The type of traffic to collect. Values:
- **All**: All traffic.
- **Allow**: Traffic allowed by access control.
- **Drop**: Traffic denied by access control.

parameters.name: VpcId
parameters.description: The ID of the VPC for which you want to view the flow log.
